title: Linux AppImage version of StatusIm (0.1.0-beta.5) doesn't seem to support Wayland
body:
I'm using the swaywm on Archlinux

When I try to run StatusIm, it outputs these messages and then terminates:

```
qt.qpa.plugin: Could not find the Qt platform plugin "wayland" in ""
This application failed to start because no Qt platform plugin could be initialized. Reinstalling the application may fix this problem.

Available platform plugins are: xcb.

Traceback (most recent call last)
/home/jenkins/workspace/nim-status-client_linux_master/src/nim_status_client.nim(203) nim_status_client
/home/jenkins/workspace/nim-status-client_linux_master/src/nim_status_client.nim(37) mainProc
/home/jenkins/workspace/nim-status-client_linux_master/vendor/nimqml/src/nimqml/private/qapplication.nim(31) newQApplication
/home/jenkins/workspace/nim-status-client_linux_master/vendor/nimqml/src/nimqml/private/qapplication.nim(3) setup
SIGABRT: Abnormal termination.
```

Hi @jokeyrhyme, thanks for the report.

Can you try the suggestion in this StackExchange anwer: https://unix.stackexchange.com/a/598498

> ...According to [ArchWiki](https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Wayland#Qt_5), to run any Qt application in `wayland` you need to install `qt5-wayland` and use the `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland` environment variable.

Hi, thanks for the quick response!

I already have this set in my environment from previous Qt apps, and I already have qt5-wayland 5.15.2-1 installed

I am wondering if qt5-wayland needs to be embedded in the AppImage? From the error message, it looks like only the XCB platform is in the AppImage, and my environment variable tells it to look for Wayland?

Ah, yep, it works when I unset the QT_QPA_PLATFORM environment variable

So, I guess the workaround for now is to maintain this variable on a per-app basis instead of setting it globally for my entire session

> I am wondering if qt5-wayland needs to be embedded in the AppImage?

We'll look into it, thanks for the suggestion!

@jokeyrhyme can you try the [AppImage build](https://status-im-prs.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-210129-212740-b0ea2a-pr.AppImage) for PR #1786?

The wayland plugin is embedded in that build so you shouldn't have to unset `QT_QPA_PLATFORM`. 🤞

Hmmm, it gets further along now, and it doesn't terminate, but the UI doesn't pop up either:

```

qt.qpa.wayland: Loading shell integration failed.
qt.qpa.wayland: Attempted to load the following shells ("xdg-shell", "xdg-shell-v6", "wl-shell", "ivi-shell")
INF 2021-01-30 09:33:47.342+11:00 Starting application...                    topics="main" tid=6929 file=nim_status_client.nim:199
```

Sorry, I feel like I've just opened a can of worms here, haha

Perhaps the long term solution is for the toolkits like GTK+ and Qt to make it more difficult to produce an app that doesn't work in wayland, and even longer term is for X11 to go away

I wouldn't stress too much about this, it's non-urgent, and we have a work-around :)

As a shortcut, I wonder if it's possible for your AppImage or code to mess with its copy of QT_QPA_PLATFORM before Qt tries to read it? So that it always runs in X11 mode (which works for me because my window manager will automatically launch Xwayland for backwards compatibility)

> As a shortcut, I wonder if it's possible for your AppImage or code to mess with its copy of QT_QPA_PLATFORM

That's a good idea! We already do something like that (setting an environment variable):  https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/master/AppRun#L3.

@jokeyrhyme can you try the [AppImage build](https://status-im-prs.ams3.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-210130-202937-5e1e37-pr.AppImage) for PR #1787?

In that build the `AppRun` script sets `export QT_QPA_PLATFORM="xcb"` prior to running the binary.

Yep, this is working for me without any workarounds, yay :)

Thanks so much
